meanings.sent1: She was gladder than ever after receiving the good news.
meanings.sent2: The children were gladder than usual when they saw the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's tail wagged even gladder when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in full bloom made the garden look gladder than a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The warm sunshine on her face made her feel gladder than a lark.

meanings.definition: To make someone happy or pleased.
meanings.sent1: The surprise gift from her friend gladdered her heart.
meanings.sent2: Kind words can easily gladder a person's spirits.
meanings.sent3: The funny movie gladdered everyone's mood at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughtful gesture gladdered his soul like a ray of light.
meanings.sent5: The delicious cake gladdered the guests at the celebration.

meanings.sent1: Today, she felt gladder than yesterday.
meanings.sent2: He seemed gladder than his friends about the upcoming trip.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked gladder than ever after catching a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The river appeared gladder than the ocean under the clear sky.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the night sky made her feel gladder than the moon.
